verse: This is what the Lord says:

“But I will pay back Babylon and all the ·Babylonians [Chaldeans] for all the ·evil things [disasters; troubles] they did to ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple] in your ·sight [eyes],” says the Lord.
This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], the God of Israel, says:
So this is what the Lord says:
This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says:

This is the message that Jeremiah the prophet gave to the officer Seraiah son of Neriah, who was the son of Mahseiah [probably Baruch’s brother; 32:12]. Seraiah went to Babylon with Zedekiah king of Judah in the fourth year Zedekiah was king of Judah [593 bc]. ·His duty was to arrange the king’s food and housing on the trip [He was the quartermaster].
Jeremiah had written on a scroll all the ·terrible [disastrous; evil] things that would happen to Babylon, all these words about Babylon.
Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “As soon as you come to Babylon, be sure to read this message so all the people can hear you.
Then say, ‘Lord, you have said that you will ·destroy [cut off] this place so that no people or animals will live in it. It will be an ·empty ruin [desolation] forever.’
After you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and throw it into the Euphrates River.
Then say, ‘In the same way Babylon will sink and will not rise again because of the ·terrible [disastrous; evil] things I will make happen here. Her people will fall.’”
